question: Who is the longest serving Prime Minister (Premier) of Japan?
explanation:
Japan’s Prime Minister (Premier) Shinzo Abe, who is also the longest-serving premier, has resigned due to poor health.
The term of the ruling party leader and Premier ends in September 2021. After his resignation, the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) will select a nominee and the winner must be formally elected in Parliament. Abe is known for his famous economic strategy named ‘Abenomics’.
